metadata.title: CVE-2024-27055 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:workqueue: Don't call cpumask_test_cpu() with -1 CPU inwq_update_node_max_active() For wq_update_node_max_active(), @off_cpu of -1indicates that no CPU is going down. The function was incorrectly callingcpumask_test_cpu() with -1 CPU leading to oopses like the following on somearchs: Unable to handle kernel paging request at virtual addressffff0002100296e0 .. pc : wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc lr :wq_update_node_max_active+0x1f0/0x1fc ... Call trace:wq_update_node_max_active+0x50/0x1fc apply_wqattrs_commit+0xf0/0x114apply_workqueue_attrs_locked+0x58/0xa0 alloc_workqueue+0x5ac/0x774workqueue_init_early+0x460/0x540 start_kernel+0x258/0x684__primary_switched+0xb8/0xc0 Code: 9100a273 35000d01 53067f00 d0016dc1(f8607a60) ---[ end trace 0000000000000000 ]--- Kernel panic - not syncing:Attempted to kill the idle task! ---[ end Kernel panic - not syncing:Attempted to kill the idle task! ]--- Fix it.
